explanation: an oval nut that grows on an oak tree and has an outer part shaped like a cup
sentence: The acorns of the oak possess a considerable economic importance as food for swine.
sentence_gap: The ______ of the oak possess a considerable economic importance as food for swine.

explanation: the sharp part of a fish hook or arrow that makes it difficult to remove from something caught on it; a remark that is funny but unkind
sentence: He got a barb stuck in his foot. I tried to ignore their barbs about my new jacket.
sentence_gap: He got a ____ stuck in his foot. I tried to ignore their ____s about my new jacket.

explanation: something on sale at a lower price than its true value
sentence: I picked up a few good bargains at the sale.
sentence_gap: I picked up a few good ________ at the sale.

explanation: to move your hand or head in a way that tells someone to come nearer
sentence: The customs official beckoned the woman to his counter.
sentence_gap: The customs official ________ the woman to his counter.

explanation: a natural skill or interest in something
sentence: She has a bent for science.
sentence_gap: She has a ____ for science.

explanation: (of people, animals, or behavior) noisy and full of life and energy
sentence: The children and the dogs raced out of the house to give me a boisterous welcome.
sentence_gap: The children and the dogs raced out of the house to give me a __________ welcome.

explanation: the body of a dead animal, especially a large one that is soon to be cut up as meat or eaten by wild animals
sentence: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the rotting carcass of the deer.
sentence_gap: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the rotting _______ of the deer.

explanation: to change from a liquid or soft state to a thick or solid state
sentence: The blood had congealed in thick black clots.
sentence_gap: The blood had _________ in thick black clots.

explanation: causing, involving, or likely to cause disagreement and argument
sentence: She has some very contentious views on education.
sentence_gap: She has some very ___________ views on education.

explanation: a short, cylinder-shaped piece of cork, plastic, or rubber that is put into the top of a bottle, especially a wine bottle, to close it
sentence: I can't get the cork out of the bottle - can you try?
sentence_gap: I can't get the ____ out of the bottle - can you try?

explanation: all of the petals of a flower as a group
sentence: The corolla has from five to nine petals, cohering at the base.
sentence_gap: The _______ has from five to nine petals, cohering at the base.

explanation: formal; no longer existing, living, or working correctly
sentence: He was a reporter for the defunct New York Herald newspaper.
sentence_gap: He was a reporter for the _______ New York Herald newspaper.

explanation: (of a place) with no people in it
sentence: These resort towns are largely deserted in winter.
sentence_gap: These resort towns are largely ________ in winter.

explanation: formal; to choose someone officially to do a particular job; to say officially that a place or thing has a particular character or purpose
sentence: The area has been designated as a nature reserve.
sentence_gap: The area has been __________ as a nature reserve.

explanation: to feel a strong dislike for someone or something because you think that that person or thing is bad or has no value
sentence: She despised him for the way he treated her sister.
sentence_gap: She ________ him for the way he treated her sister.

explanation: believing strongly in a religion and obeying all its rules or principles
sentence: He was also very devout, and his morals were irreproachable.
sentence_gap: He was also very ______, and his morals were irreproachable.

explanation: to (cause something to) spread in many directions
sentence: Television is a powerful means of diffusing knowledge. Oxygen diffuses from the lungs into the bloodstream.
sentence_gap: Television is a powerful means of _________ knowledge. Oxygen diffuses from the lungs into the bloodstream.

explanation: formal; the feeling of not liking someone or something and thinking that they do not deserve your interest or respect
sentence: His disdain for politicians is obvious.
sentence_gap: His _______ for politicians is obvious.

explanation: a feeling of unhappiness and disappointment
sentence: Aid workers were said to have been filled with dismay by the appalling conditions that the refugees were living in.
sentence_gap: Aid workers were said to have been filled with ______ by the appalling conditions that the refugees were living in.

explanation: an argument or disagreement, especially an official one between, for example, workers and employers or two countries with a common border
sentence: The unions are in dispute with management over pay.
sentence_gap: The unions are in _______ with management over pay.

explanation: very angry about unfair things that have happened to you
sentence: He died a disillusioned and embittered old man. They ignored all her pleas and she became very embittered.
sentence_gap: He died a disillusioned and __________ old man. They ignored all her pleas and she became very __________.

explanation: the discovering of secrets, especially political or military information of another country or the industrial information of a business
sentence: Three people were also accused of engaging in espionage against a rival firm.
sentence_gap: Three people were also accused of engaging in _________ against a rival firm.

explanation: very beautiful and delicate
sentence: Her wedding dress was absolutely exquisite.
sentence_gap: Her wedding dress was absolutely _________.

explanation: disapproving; not serious about a serious subject, in an attempt to be funny or to appear clever
sentence: Stop being facetious; this is serious.
sentence_gap: Stop being _________; this is serious.

explanation: often stopping and starting and not happening in a regular or continuous way
sentence: Her sleep was fitful, and he walked to the bed, standing beside it in the dark.
sentence_gap: Her sleep was ______, and he walked to the bed, standing beside it in the dark.

explanation: to make someone upset and confused, especially when they are trying to do something
sentence: Don’t let that new tax form fluster you – it’s not as bad as it looks.
sentence_gap: Don’t let that new tax form _______ you – it’s not as bad as it looks.

explanation: continuous change
sentence: The housing market is still in a state of flux.
sentence_gap: The housing market is still in a state of ____.

explanation: very brightly colored in an unpleasant way
sentence: The coffee shop, painted a garish pink, is a landmark in the neighborhood.
sentence_gap: The coffee shop, painted a ______ pink, is a landmark in the neighborhood.

explanation: extremely cold
sentence: The dining room was glacial.
sentence_gap: The dining room was _______.

explanation: extremely tiring and difficult, and demanding great effort and determination
sentence: Runners are taking part in a grueling 100-mile race in the mountains above Los Angeles.
sentence_gap: Runners are taking part in a ________ 100-mile race in the mountains above Los Angeles.

explanation: a square piece of cloth or paper used for cleaning the nose or drying the eyes when they are wet with tears
sentence: She took out her handkerchief and blew her nose loudly.
sentence_gap: She took out her ____________ and blew her nose loudly.

explanation: to move something heavy using a lot of effort
sentence: He heaved the bag onto his shoulder.
sentence_gap: He ______ the bag onto his shoulder.

explanation: an amount of food given to one person at one time
sentence: She gave me a very large helping of pasta.
sentence_gap: She gave me a very large _______ of pasta.

explanation: at the back of an animal’s body
sentence: Phil’s dog stands on her hind legs to greet me.
sentence_gap: Phil’s dog stands on her ____ legs to greet me.

explanation: a piece of metal that fastens the edge of a door, window, lid, etc. to something else and allows it to open or close
sentence: We had to take the front door off its hinges to get our new sofa into the house.
sentence_gap: We had to take the front door off its ______ to get our new sofa into the house.

explanation: the act of being friendly and welcoming to guests and visitors
sentence: The local people showed me great hospitality.
sentence_gap: The local people showed me great ___________.

explanation: literary; to ask someone to do or not do something in a very sincere, emotional, and determined way
sentence: She implored her parents not to send her away to school.
sentence_gap: She ________ her parents not to send her away to school.

explanation: to encourage someone to do or feel something unpleasant or violent
sentence: She incited racial hatred by distributing anti-Semitic leaflets.
sentence_gap: She _______ racial hatred by distributing anti-Semitic leaflets.

explanation: having a lot of small parts that are arranged in a complicated or delicate way
sentence: The watch mechanism is extremely intricate and very difficult to repair.
sentence_gap: The watch mechanism is extremely _________ and very difficult to repair.

explanation: disapproving; a servant or someone who behaves like one by obeying someone else's orders or by doing unpleasant work for them
sentence: He treats us all like his lackeys.
sentence_gap: He treats us all like his _______.

explanation: informal; someone who has been punished by being put in prison for a very long time or until they die
sentence: In the 1980s, 726 lifers were paroled.
sentence_gap: In the 1980s, 726 ______ were paroled.

explanation: formal; having the habit of talking a lot
sentence: He sipped it with relish and soon became somewhat loquacious.
sentence_gap: He sipped it with relish and soon became somewhat __________.

explanation: the action or skill of being able to copy the voice, movements, etc. of others
sentence: Parrots specialize in vocal mimicry.
sentence_gap: Parrots specialize in vocal _______.

explanation: a dog whose parents are of different breeds
sentence: And I like walking my dog, a very old mongrel.
sentence_gap: And I like walking my dog, a very old _______.

explanation: one end of a rope tied to form a circle that can be tightened round something such as a person's neck to hang them
sentence: They put him on the back of a horse and looped a noose around his neck.
sentence_gap: They put him on the back of a horse and looped a _____ around his neck.

explanation: offensive, rude, or shocking, usually because of being too obviously related to sex or showing sex
sentence: In the raid, police found several boxes of obscene DVDs.
sentence_gap: In the raid, police found several boxes of _______ DVDs.

explanation: formal; to remove a difficulty, especially so that action to deal with it becomes unnecessary
sentence: A peaceful solution would obviate the need to send a UN military force.
sentence_gap: A peaceful solution would _______ the need to send a UN military force.

explanation: to be, or do something, better than someone else
sentence: He always tries to outdo everybody else in the class.
sentence_gap: He always tries to _____ everybody else in the class.

explanation: a small smooth round stone, especially one found on a beach or in a river
sentence: This part of the coast has pebble beaches.
sentence_gap: This part of the coast has ______ beaches.

explanation: formal; (of an action) done as a duty or habit, without real interest, attention, or feeling
sentence: The guard glanced perfunctorily at her pass and let her through.
sentence_gap: The guard glanced _____________ at her pass and let her through.

explanation: confused, because something is difficult to understand or solve
sentence: The students looked perplexed, so the teacher tried to explain once again.
sentence_gap: The students looked _________, so the teacher tried to explain once again.

explanation: to press something, especially someone's skin, strongly between two hard things such as a finger and a thumb, usually causing pain
sentence: My sister's always pinching me and it really hurts.
sentence_gap: My sister's always ________ me and it really hurts.

explanation: to hold someone, especially by the arms, to prevent them from moving
sentence: He was pinioned to the wall by two men while another one repeatedly punched him.
sentence_gap: He was ________ to the wall by two men while another one repeatedly punched him.

explanation: something that is done or said in order to get an advantage, often dishonestly
sentence: There are various ploys we can use if necessary.
sentence_gap: There are various _____ we can use if necessary.

explanation: formal; now; at the present time
sentence: Of 200 boats, only 20 are presently operational.
sentence_gap: Of 200 boats, only 20 are _________ operational.

explanation: formal; existing at or since the beginning of the world or the universe
sentence: The planet Jupiter contains large amounts of the primordial gas and dust out of which the solar system was formed.
sentence_gap: The planet Jupiter contains large amounts of the __________ gas and dust out of which the solar system was formed.

explanation: to bounce back after hitting something
sentence: The ball rebounded off the rim and Schultz dunked it in.
sentence_gap: The ball _________ off the rim and Schultz dunked it in.

explanation: to find a way in which two situations or beliefs that are opposed to each other can agree and exist together
sentence: It is sometimes difficult to reconcile science and religion.
sentence_gap: It is sometimes difficult to _________ science and religion.

explanation: the fact of showing that you are very sorry for something bad you have done in the past, and wish that you had not done it
sentence: This was an extremely violent crime, for which the boy showed no repentance.
sentence_gap: This was an extremely violent crime, for which the boy showed no __________.

explanation: a list of people's names, often with the jobs they have been given to do
sentence: If you look on the duty roster, you'll see when you're working.
sentence_gap: If you look on the duty ______, you'll see when you're working.

explanation: (of a person's face) looking red and healthy
sentence: Her face was ruddy and healthy-looking.
sentence_gap: Her face was _____ and healthy-looking.

explanation: to make a continuous low sound
sentence: Please excuse my stomach rumbling - I haven't eaten all day.
sentence_gap: Please excuse my stomach ________ - I haven't eaten all day.

explanation: a trick intended to deceive someone
sentence: It was just a ruse to distract her while his partner took the money.
sentence_gap: It was just a ____ to distract her while his partner took the money.

explanation: to make a sound like food cooking in hot fat
sentence: The sausages are sizzling in the pan.
sentence_gap: The sausages are ________ in the pan.

explanation: to join pieces of metal together using solder
sentence: These wires must be soldered to the pins.
sentence_gap: These wires must be ________ to the pins.

explanation: literary; (especially of the wind or sea) to make a long high or low sound while moving
sentence: The wind soughed through the towering pines nearby.
sentence_gap: The wind _______ through the towering pines nearby.

explanation: a very small piece of fire that flies out from something that is burning, or one that is made by rubbing two hard things together, or a flash of light made by electricity
sentence: Sparks were flying out of the bonfire and blowing everywhere.
sentence_gap: ______ were flying out of the bonfire and blowing everywhere.

explanation: to waste money or supplies, or to waste opportunities by not using them to your advantage
sentence: They'll quite happily squander a whole year's savings on two weeks in the sun.
sentence_gap: They'll quite happily ________ a whole year's savings on two weeks in the sun.

explanation: to move from side to side in an awkward way, sometimes because of nervousness, embarrassment, or pain
sentence: Nobody spoke for at least five minutes and Rachel squirmed in her chair with embarrassment.
sentence_gap: Nobody spoke for at least five minutes and Rachel ________ in her chair with embarrassment.

explanation: loyal, especially for a long time; able to be trusted
sentence: She has been a stalwart supporter of the party for many years.
sentence_gap: She has been a ________ supporter of the party for many years.

explanation: to make someone unable to think clearly, usually because they are extremely tired or have taken drugs
sentence: He was stupefied by the amount they had spent.
sentence_gap: He was _________ by the amount they had spent.

explanation: having a lower or less important position
sentence: The individual's needs are subordinate to those of the group.
sentence_gap: The individual's needs are ___________ to those of the group.

explanation: formal; to include something or someone as part of a larger group
sentence: Soldiers from many different countries have been subsumed into the United Nations peace-keeping force.
sentence_gap: Soldiers from many different countries have been ________ into the United Nations peace-keeping force.

explanation: a picture or pattern that is made by weaving colored wool onto heavy cloth; the art of doing this
sentence: There were rich vases as tall as a man and tapestries hung from the rough stone.
sentence_gap: There were rich vases as tall as a man and __________ hung from the rough stone.

explanation: the area on each side of your head in front of the top of your ear
sentence: The vein at his temple throbbed angrily.
sentence_gap: The vein at his ______ throbbed angrily.

explanation: to cause a person or animal to suffer or worry
sentence: The animals are tormented mercilessly by flies and mosquitoes.
sentence_gap: The animals are _________ mercilessly by flies and mosquitoes.

explanation: allowing light to pass through but not transparent
sentence: The sky was a pale translucent blue. The vase was made from translucent, milky glass.
sentence_gap: The sky was a pale ___________ blue. The vase was made from ___________, milky glass.

explanation: formal; fear or worry about what is going to happen
sentence: We view future developments with some trepidation.
sentence_gap: We view future developments with some ___________.

explanation: a piece of thin material worn by women to cover the face or head
sentence: After the ceremony, the bride lifted up her veil to kiss her husband.
sentence_gap: After the ceremony, the bride lifted up her ____ to kiss her husband.

explanation: (of a plant) to become weak and begin to bend towards the ground, or (of a person) to become weaker, tired, or less confident
sentence: Cut flowers will soon wilt without water.
sentence_gap: Cut flowers will soon ____ without water.
